Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (77.78%) toPac-525R: 33%; W: 33%; I=L=K: 11%.  GRAVY: -1.31; M Wt: 1399.708; Mol formula: C69H105N22O10; molar extinction coeff: 16650.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli (MIC 6.2 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 6.2 ug/ml), Gram+ S. aeurus (MIC 3.1 ug/ml), fungi C. albicans (MIC 3.1 ug/ml), and F. solani (MIC 25 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-insensitive:E. coli (100-300 mM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:E. coli (5 mM salt); NaCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (100-300 mM salt); MgCl2-sensitive:P. aeruginosa (5 mM salt); NaCl-insensitive:S. auerus (100-200 mM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:S. auerus (5 mM salt); NaCl-sensitive:C. albicans (100-300 mM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:C. albicans (5 mM salt); NaCl-sensitive:F. solani (100-300 mM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:F. solani (5 mM salt).Toxicity: HC50 400 ug/ml, not hemo.lytic.  Provided by Arjun Nair.
Literature Information.Author: Qi X, Zhou C, Li P, Xu W, Cao Y, Ling H, Ning Chen W, Ming Li C, Xu R, Lamrani M, Mu Y, Leong SS, Wook Chang M, Chan-Park MB.2010
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2010 Jul 30;398(3):594-600. doi: 10.1016/j.bbrc.2010.06.131.Pub-Med.
Literature Information.Title: Novel short antibacterial and antifungal peptides with low cytotoxicity: Efficacy and action mechanisms.
